The worst part, the back lip, where the snow shoes typically go in, they have cut the leather, that peers above the edge's end, and with each step, it is quite abrasive. I literally took 20 steps in the house, and realized, I'm begging for a pair of blisters near the achilles hills. No Thank you, I know after a single day of walking i these shoes, it will blister the skin, and would be extremely uncomfortable, after having walked less then 20 steps inside my bedroom,. It is a shame, bought them for a trip, and now, going to return this piece of crap.. I like the shoes. Stylish and comfortable. Nice quality. But they are NOT slip-ons.
Half size to small, good cushioning, soft upper, great value for the price (under 15), BUT, there's a sewing on the inside that rubs too hard my big toe. Pity.

I bought these to wear when I do weight training since they provide foot protection without a thick sole with a raised heel. I wore them for one workout and I'm in love with them! They are so comfortable I think I'm going to buy another pair to wear all the time! I'm not sure how long they'll last, but even if they wear out faster than traditional sneakers they are affordable enough to replace them more frequently. I originally ordered the same shoe size I normally wear but they were too big so I returned them and got a size smaller and they fit great.
Very comfortable. I have a toe injury so the additional space is helpful.

My brother has a somewhat unusual foot shape that is wide all around. The shoes from this manufacturer worked very well for him. Shoes like these aren’t easy to get from the country he lives in now, but they’re the most comfortable ones that fit him. These shoes are made very well with great quality and excellent materials, and the prices were also very good! We are hoping the manufacturer will keep producing these shoes and provide more variety of styles. We got 5 pairs already and will definitely be ordering more! Thank you so much!
Shoes are comfortable and exactly as described. The wide toe box is exactly what my wife feet need. My size is 10 1/2 EEE. I ordered 11 size and fits perfectly.

My husband has a very wide foot and constant back pain from Arthritis in his back. He is constantly at a 5 pain level and shuffles his feet like he is 80.  He is a professional so he feels he has to wear dress shoes.  I bought 2 pairs of bare feet shoes for him for Christmas. He isn't much for change but gave the shoes a try. He was incredibly surprised at how comfortable the shoes are! And his pain leave at the end of the day was a 2 not a 5. He was over the moon and he has heard a lot of compliments and people asking him what he is doing because he is not shuffling as much!  We are supposed impressed that I bought him another pair already! And it's only Dec. 29! I also bought a pair for myself, his mother, my mother and our 4 children ages 6-15. Everyone loved them! And all are asking for another pair already!I greatly suggest barefoot shoes . They are amazing!
These are great. I have had pain for quite a while. Switched to some barefoot shoes which helped. Then tried these. They are like wearing slippers all day, and my feet are elated.
They aren’t comfortable at all . Not going to be buying them any more

I’ve been into barefoot shoes for a few years now and I am extremely thankful that there are companies making stylish barefoot shoes. Enter JACKSHIBO. These shoes are awesome. I’ve only had this pair for a few days, but I’ve absolutely fallen in love with them. I had washed my other pair of Whitin barefoot shoes and they ended up getting messed up. So, I took a leap of faith and bought these shoes, which are a similar model and a bit cheaper. And I can’t describe how pleasantly surprised I was! These shoes are very comfortable for my wide feet and let my feet feel free and unencumbered. They feel like a house shoe almost, but are stylish enough to wear out and about.  The price is another high point. That, coupled with being well-built, makes these shoes an absolute bargain. Definitely recommend!
i bought and returned these, I need a wide box shoe. they state they are. well not so much. i gave it 2 stares because maybe they would work for folks who don't need the wide box

Many in the comments aren't impressed. I am! These shoes are well-made, they look great, and they're extremely comfortable, all for an excellent price. You can't beat it! I highly recommend buying a pair of these comfortable barefoot shoes!
The shoes are everything that are advertised. They fit nicely, feel and look good. I'm very happy with these and will certainly consider this brand when I nee a replacement.

Whatever you do, do not call these shoes. At best these could be considered slippers you may see at and 5 and 10, again at best. These are more like house shoes for that reason I rated a 4.  Comfortable. Light  Wright, slip on like a slipped, fit s well
Comfortable with or without socks

I got these for plantar fasciitis, jury is still out on that, slow process. The shoes helped to accommodate inserts; they are taking some time to get used to but I'm getting there

This pair of shoes fit nicely since they are wide toe and give my feet room inside without being so tight. The shoe fabric is made very well and looks nice and stylish. The sole has a lot of support and my feet feel comfortable in them. I like that I can wear these all day walking and my feet do not feel tired at the end of the day.

I tried using these barefoot shoes for walking and weight lifting. What I found was that it felt uncomfortable being without foot support. I don't think I will try this style of shoe again. Comfortable shoe, MESH fabric, , solid sole, but kinda looks like a clown shoe...so I bought 3 pairs great price 11 dollars each!! Call me BOZO!! 😊🤫

In comparison to it's competitors, these shoes are a good buy at a reasonable price.  They are very lightweight and they are wide (in the toes). For those who don't experience much/any foot pain, these minimalist shoes may feel like you're walking on a cloud. In general, these are very comfortable, but those with foot pain - some discomfort may catch up to you as there isn't much padding (that is to be expected with this style).  I like to wear these for doing shopping or activities nearby, but due to some foot discomforts, I wouldn't wear these for long periods.  All that in mind, I think these are great shoes and have a cool look.

These are plenty wide, but feel like I need to size down (which never happens for me) because of how ample and roomy they are.  They are minimalist shoes so that comes with slim zero drop soles and you notice it.  Some people want that and I prefer it than high heeled shoes personally.  Wide shoes aren't most aesthetic looking shoes so be warned that they can't hide all the girth and it shows.8/10 I would recommend it.  I hope this review is helpful.

I found these shoes to be very nice for the price! They are comfortable and live up to the no-drop sole advertisement, providing a good balance for walking. I am always on the hunt for wide toolbox, barefoot shoes. I am a woman, but these looked very cute so I ordered the smallest men’s size and they fit perfectly. M my feet are 25.5cm x 11cm full splay in the toes. They are comparable to my Whitin slip on loafers aren’t offered anymore. The soles are flexible, the toe box is roomy, they’re easy to put on, and they look awesome. Something better than Whitins that they offer is that they have a removable insole, and when you remove it, there is still a nice footbed area. So rather than just having your foot on the inside of the soul with exposed stitching, they actually have a second permanent fabric piece so they’re more comfortable if, like me, you like to remove the insoles for more ground field or area. They were a super deal and I really like them!
Love these shoes
not a lot of support. definitely gives barefoot vibes.
These are some of the most comfortable shoes I own. Excellent value for the money. Great fit. You can wear them all day and barely feel anything.

It is almost impossible to find a pair of shoes that my teenager does not complain about. He loves these shoes. They are super lightweight, breathable, and versatile. He can wear them with jeans, shorts, and khakis. They clean up well and have held up great so far.
I got this JACKSHIBO Men’s Barefoot Shoes Minimalist Walking Sneakers Wide Toe Box Zero Drop for my husband! He stated they are comfortable! They fit his wide foot!
I wear them around the house. They are just as comfortable as hey dudes, maybe even more. A little heavier in weight, but not bad.

First of all, for all of these people out there looking at minimalist shoes you need to understand how they are designed and what they’re supposed to be. They’re designed to be like wearing no shoes at all, as if you’re barefoot. Sure, it takes a little time to get used to wearing them but in the end it’s worth it. I can honestly say that I have less foot, leg, and back pain since I’ve been wearing them daily. For the people that say there’s no support I have one question, when you’re barefoot, do you feel any support under your feet? Of course not. I for one would definitely recommend and buy these shoes again.
This is my house shoe. It is light and soft. Thanks
Exceeds expectation for a budget minded barefoot shoes. Removable sole allows for better ground feel.  These are barefoot shoes and check all of the boxes of a barefoot shoe.

These shoes are different. I have never worn any shoes like these. I like the shoes. They are made well and I find them comfortable to wear. The design is simple. They are easy to put on and take off. I think the shoes are a good quality item.
These are very comfortable shoes, they literally feel as if you have nothing on. They do fit great as well. These will definitely be my go to shoes.
Bought ten days ago for 19.99 A bit funny looking once on foot When I came back to write review price had increased to 29.99. Worth 19.99 in my opinion.

评论概述: Funky shoes that kinda grow on you.
评论详情: 100/100  I wasn't sure about these. Honestly . . . but I've heard a lot "on the grapevine" about this type of shoe and decided to give them a try.  When first worn, they made me a little clumsy. The wide "front end" tends to get in the way since they're so different than what you're probably wearing. After a while, you learn to navigate them and they're just shoes.  The wide front DOES give plenty of toe room and this shoe in particular is comfy. I can wear them all day long and my feet don't hurt. I also like the soles. I can walk out into the yard and not worry about them getting a little damp or dirty. They are waterproof and easily cleaned.  I DID add insoles which made them a little more comfy.  Ultimately, is it worth the price? Yes

These shoes fit a little large i believe. That is something to keep in mind immediately.  Because of that, the heels rubbed on my feet and caused blisters. Now, I wear thick socks to avoid that when I plan on wearing them. The soles are comfortable and the shoes are breathable. I don't think they are the highest quality in general but decent for the cost.

评论概述: Groove into Comfort with JACKSHIBO Barefoot Shoes!
评论详情: Man, these JACKSHIBO Men’s Barefoot Shoes are a game-changer! If you’re looking for that barefoot vibe but still want to protect your feet, these kicks are where it’s at. The wide toe box gives my feet room to breathe, like they’re chillin' in a hammock. Walking in them feels so natural, almost like I'm not wearing shoes at all, but with just the right amount of protection for hitting the pavement or the trail.  They've got that sleek, minimalist style too, which means I can rock them casually or even when I'm out for a light workout. Super flexible, lightweight, and built for movement – it's like my feet are finally free. JACKSHIBO, you nailed it!
I was excited about these shoes, they were super comfortable when i got them. After wearing them for 2 days they are hurting my feet. I dont recommend.

评论概述: Well made, and holds up to wear even in the water
评论详情: These are great! These are a zero drop with a minimal sole, but not so minimal that you feel like there's nothing there. This allows you to feel the ground and what you're stepping on, but not so minimal that you're actually walking with nothing on. The material is breathable, and can get wet; have walked through streams and instantly soaked, but not uncomfortable (though it took 4 days to completely dry out). It does have a wide toe box and appreciate this as my toes can continue to spread out. Very comfortable and I can see these lasting! Would recommend.

评论概述: I've got really bad feet but these feel great for walking around in
评论详情: My friend doctor saying I got the flattest feet. He's ever seen and to always where some kind of shoe while walking around. These are the best slip ons i've found yet way better than slippers

Got these kind of on a whim, because I was looking for another pair of shoes. I was intrigued by the barefoot shoes and the title and decided to give them a go.  When I got them in, I just have not been impressed. I saw what it said about this is supposed to be more natural, but if you’re wearing a shoe from what I understand, you need at least some kind of support. They feel like water shoes, except they’re less useful as they don’t dry off very quickly. I’ll keep them around and use them for maybe going to the grocery store or something small. But I doubt I’ll use it much in the everyday world.

First, the insole has a heel rise of what feels like 2-4mm, so in order to be zero drop you need to remove the insole. Second, the upper eyelet is too low and the upper collar flays outward. Even with replacement of laces and increased lace tension, it still sits too low to fix the weird appearance. Finally, there is no entire shoe is lined with some kind of soft foam which is not breathable, and there are no vents. While it is comfortable to wear if the insole is removed, the other poor design choices render this model unusable.

This is a great wide toe box shoe. You can use it with or without the insole for a more barefoot feel, I removed mine. It's very comfortable and roomy even with the insoles. My feet feel great and my toes aren't smashed. I usually go up a half size for regular sneakers to accommodate my wide feet, but with these I can get my correct size. I'd get more of these sneakers.

评论概述: Great, comfy, light, breathable, flexy and good-looking
评论详情: These were sized just right and showed up quickly and well-packaged. They are very light, breathable and comfortable. They are great if you want nice black shoes that look good or comfortable shoes for work, casual wear and walking. Highly recommend.

评论概述: Prefect for kicking around on a cruise ship
评论详情: Lightweight minimalist easy to pack. On flat surfaces these work well, I have not tried them on rough surfaces and don't plan to. The black and white colors looked more than casual. I even wore them on more formal evenings. I’ve gotten used to the wider at the toe look and appreciate the comfy feel. The size is true to fit.

评论概述: Great fit and they are comfortable and keep my feet warm and dry.
评论详情: I needed an extra pair of sneakers that I could use around the house that were lightweight and comfortable and fit well. These do all of those and then some. Now I have a pair of shoes that I can grab and put on to do chores in and around the house and I can step outside without having to worry about getting my feet wet or stepping on gravel. These shoes keep my feet warm and dry and comfortable whether I'm indoors or outside. And the best part is they fit great.
These shoes are comfortable but made my knees hurt. They are not for me. It was nice not having my toes squeezed together, though.

These shoes are perfect for someone who wants a roomy toe box. I definitely have plenty of room with absolutely no pinching of my toes. The shoes are lightweight, breathable, and flexible. They are great as a minimal support walking shoe. They fit true to size.

These shoes are alright, not too bad. This is for wide toe box but I'm not sure as it looks a little goofy being that wide. I have several wide toe box shoes and they look more natural and have better feet support. These seem to be lacking in that department. Not bad like I said but could be better.

These are interesting shoes, but I'm a little conflicted on how to review them.  They do have an interesting, almost barefoot feel to them, while still providing some extra grip and protection for your feet.  My biggest complaint is the insole, which provides very little cushion for your foot.  If you're going to be walking or standing for an extended period of time, these are going to get uncomfortable. I do like them for weightlifting as well, because they have truly flat, no rise soles.  Ask yourself what your needs are, how tough your feet are, and how long you'll be wearing them.  They are interesting shoes, but probably not for everybody.

These Minimalist Barefoot Sneakers for men are a great choice for anyone looking for lightweight, flexible, and comfortable footwear.  My husband has a wide feet and these toe box is perfect for him, giving his toes plenty of space to move naturally. One thing to note is that for sizing, I’d recommend going a half size lower for a better fit.  Overall, they provide a comfortable experience with a zero drop sole that's ideal for trail running or casual wear.

I ordered these for my husband because he needed more casual shoes. These are so versatile, they can be boat shoes, wear to the pool OR wear to the office with dress jeans. They are dressy AND casual looking. He really likes them and says I always find him the best stuff! He wears them on long evening walks and says they are really comfortable.

These “Barefoot Sneakers” are perfect for the “heel-down” drummers like me.  They really mimic the effect of playing barefoot on the bass drum pedals.  My technique is not affected by this shoe at all.  The flat sole or zero drop sole is the secret for “heel-down” player such as myself - it is necessary to get the right angle of my ankle and foot so I can manipulate the footboard properly.When compared to the typical running shoe it is obvious what the differences are.  This pair was ordered as a Size 9.5.  They run big and feel more like 10s or 10.5s.  The pictures shoe a typical Size 10 sneaker and these 9.5 Barefoot Sneakers.  For me each has its own purpose.  I like that these also look stylish (understated) - there’s no emblem or writing on the body of the shoe anywhere.  The wide toe box combined with the stretchy fabric of the shoe material add to the “bigger” feeling of these Size 9.5s.Overall I will use these primary to play drums and as a “house” shoe.  I don’t think I’ll take them outside, but if I do and the experience is vastly different then I’ll update this review.  I can recommend them to drummers, even “heel-up” drummers!

This shoes are nice and wide. The length is average for the size. The sole is flexible and offers great traction to prevent slipping. The upper is soft and flexible but feels sturdy like it should last. The insole is thin, foamy but completely removable so you can easily slip in a different one if you would like. They look nice too.

I chose these shoes for one of my boys to wear, since they have wide feet like me and prefer wide toe boxes. I chose a size 11 according to the chart, and these look to run big. These shoes have plenty of space fo his feet, almost to the point of being too big. He reports that the shoes are comfortable to wear for hours, easy to walk around in, and they get a good grip on smooth surfaces. The shoes look to be well made, but they do look a little silly with the large toe box.  JACKSHIBO Men's Minimalist Barefoot Sneakers Wide Toe Box Zero Drop Sole Trail Running Shoes Black

评论概述: A very comfortable pair of walking shoes
评论详情: All during the spring, summer, and fall I spend quite a bit of time outdoors, so getting in my daily walking time is pretty easy. But in the wintertime, I typically get my walking time indoors. And more often than not, that involves the gymnasium at my son's school. But, here's the thing. Not only do I need a comfortable pair of walking shoes for those brisk walking times, those shoes need to have non-marking soles as well. Which these JACKSHIBO Men's Wide Toe Minimalist Walking Shoes can handle with ease. The wide toe box provides a comfortable fit for those of us that extra wide widths. The shoes run true to size, and the insoles are quite adequately padded for an extended brisk walking session. And did I mention that they are actually quite good looking? But don't take my word for all this, order a pair of your own and find out for yourself!

The JACKSHIBO Men;s Minimalist Barefoot Sneakers with Wide Toe Box and Zero Drop Sole Trail Running Shoes could use more sole thickness and cushion. I will not be using them for running as they do not have that type of support. Mostly good for light casual use.

评论概述: Like slippers you can wear anywhere, anytime.
评论详情: I like the trend in minimalist footwear. These have a bit more to them in the footbed/sole than most. Still incredibly light weight, still airy and comfortable, just a bit more protection from stones and debris for me. These have an all-purpose look to the too, a lot like a deck shoe. Cool.

I now have a lot of shoes in this style so I’ve gotten to be what I consider a pretty good judge of them.  This particular pair has its pluses and minuses:  As I have really wide feet (EEEEE), I prefer a shoe with a nice big toe box, and this one is fairly big. Before ordering, I took a guess that it wasn’t as wide as some, though, so I ordered 1/2 a size up and that was a pretty good guess. They’re a little long, but any smaller and the toe box wouldn’t have been comfy, IMO.  I don’t like this design as much as my other footwear of this style. I prefer simpler. This one - with the moc toe, linen weave texture, etc. is just a bit over-styled compared to what I have found I like… but not terribly so, and it is still something I’ll happily wear around the house or for a quick trip to the store even.  I’m not so much a slipper guy - so I’m glad footwear like this is available. Overall, I like this pair and am happy to them to rotate through!

I really like the width because it doesn’t squish my wide feet, which adds to the barefoot feel. The insoles and soles are flat and lightweight, but remain comfortable. The soles grip quite well. The cushioning around the ankle keeps it from digging in when tightened. If you need arch support then you’ll want to add different insoles. These are very dude-like, casual shoes, but a little more refined so I can wear them to work. The material seems pretty durable and easy to clean.  I like them, I have no regrets in ordering them, and I will probably order another pair.

"These shoes are SOOOOO comfy. I absolutely love them and need them in every color." This is the exact quote from a friend that has never had minimalist shoes and I ordered. The best shoes ever owned.

These shoes really are a great value for the comfort and support they provide. The stitching in these shoes is my only concern. I will update as they have been worn for a while to see how the stitching actually holds up. The shoes are super comfortable and a very good deal for a pair of zero drop shoes. They are like wearing other barefoot shoes that we have had in how they feel when I walk in them. Currently I do really like them for what they are.
I got these shoes for my husband, he wears a size 12. Through 13 he has wide feet and I got a size 12 and they fit him great ! Very comfortable  and light weight shoes.

This is super comfortable with the supplied sole insert. It's a good way to get into more barefoot foot ware. I would recommend dropping a half size to accomodate for the large toe box and ultra flexible nature.

评论概述: Runs big, definitely size down a half or even a whole size
评论详情: I have wide feet and finding comfortable shoes can be a real chore. These are so comfortable, it's amazing how much of a difference they make over traditionally styled shoes. Yes, they look a little funny with the wide toe box, but they're comfortable for my feet and that's so much more important than looking hip. I honestly don't think it's that bad and I think that you see it more when you're wearing them than other people see from their perspective.  The build and material quality seems good, though one of the shoes did not have the paper stuffed all the way down into the toes so it arrived with a flattened toe box. I've been stuffing it with the paper overnight and I think it'll regain it's shape.  I haven't worn these shoes for more than a few hours at a time yet, as the instructions suggest easing into barefoot shoes to avoid discomfort. I don't know if I'll be wearing these at work where I stand and move all day, but after work I throw these shoes on and my feet feel liberated. So far I'm really enjoying the barefoot style.  If you struggle to find wide comfortable shoes, give these a shot. These are the most comfortable shoes I've worn in a long time.

These are great shoes. They’re well made, nice color and give wide feet lots of wiggle room. Very comfortable, feet didn’t hurt after long hike and shoes barely look used. Great quality. Highly recommend

I have been wearing barefoot shoes for over a year now, so am no stranger to "barefoot" or "minimalist" shoes.  These are the real deal - they allow your toes to splay out correctly, and have a zero drop sole.  Furthermore, they have a very flexible sole so that it mimics going barefoot.  The shoes fit true to size.  Nobody would confuse these with high end shoes, but they seem decently constructed.  I spent an entire day walking around a theme park and at the end of the day my feet and back felt great, so I find them to be comfortable.  For the price these are a good deal, and are easy to recommend if you are looking to try out barefoot shoes.

These are awesome, and love every aspect of them except that the back digs into my achilles tendon when I walk, so I must wear thick enough socks to prevent a blister. Otherwise, I love the width of the toe box, the flexibility, the fabric, everything!!

评论概述: Decent shoes with good toe space
评论详情: So far, I have been using these shoes around the house and for shorter runs to the store. They are wider than a standard shoe, which is good for someone like me with a white foot. The padding on the bottom is not that thick, but that’s also kind of what they’re going for as their manual says they’re trying to create a barefoot feeling. The bottom rubber hole is on the thinner side and so it allows it to be more flexible helping create some of that barefoot feeling I guess.  The style of these look good. The black is pretty much solid black and although there’s some different material materials and textures, they look pretty uniformly black from a distance.  The only reason I did not give these five stars is there is not an adequate amount of padding on the backside of the shoe at the ankle. I worry that that area will become a nuisance or cause a sore ankle after wearing these as a daily use.

These are really nice if you need a wide toe box. I have duck feet, wide in the front and narrow at the back and these haven’t bothered me at all. I’ve got some decent time wearing these and will give my comments.  I’m giving 4 stars because the insoles are very lacking. If these had memory foam like the hey dudes they’d be an easy 5 stars. With the insole pulled they are rock hard. Because the uppers are so comfortable I’ve purchased insoles BUT that makes these essentially a $50 dollar shoe which I think the build quality of the lower and insole don’t match.  The uppers are really nice and seem durable. It’s pretty minimalist except for padding around the upper cuff. Stitching is nice with no fray and I don’t have any concerns about durability.  Fitment is definitely catered to wide. I’m traditionally an 11.5 and these are right on the mark. The wide front toe box is a dream come true though the heel leaves a lot of extra room. Fortunately the padding around the cuff is thick enough that my heel doesn’t want to pop out when walking. Perhaps when my insoles arrive it’ll be a better fit.  I would absolutely recommend these. The bottoms are nowhere near the utter comfort of Hey Dudes but the uppers are a dream come true for wide toe boxes. If they upgraded the cushion/insoles on these they would be an easy 5 stars. If you like rock hard bottoms then you’ll have no issues, otherwise plan on upgrading insoles.

My son-in-law will only wear flip flops or go barefoot. I knew (highly hoped) he would love these, and I was right! Very very comfortable and sized correctly. He said its like he's walking barefoot, just with extra protection. Very comfortable for wide feet. Coming from someone who feels like shoes are too restrictive, hearing him happily reference these shoes is a big compliment to the makers! And of course, seeing him wearing something other than flip flops in cooler temps will make ME very happy.

When I ordered these shoes they didn't have my size so I ordered a 1/2 size bigger thinking I could wear them with thick socks. The shoes are actually loose on my feet but so comfortable I want to hold on to them. Before ordering I thought they would look like Donald Duck's feet but they're actually not bad looking, I have the black with white soles in 8.5.

These feel comfortable to wear around the house and even outside. They are fit but not snug or tight and flow well with the natural movement of my foot. The thing is, they run quite easily. Not even a month in and I already have a hole in the fabric. I wasn't even doing anything rigorous. I'm not sure if maybe it got caught on something but, it didn't ship with this hole and now it's here. There's also a slight separation between the top part of the shoe and the sole.
Nice shoes for running errands in!

These are very comfortable shoes, not sure if the "zero drop" is for me, but it doesn't take anything away. As someone with feet that sweat a lot the extra room for my feet to breathe is great. My goto slip on for my short 10 min. walk to the mailbox.

These do have a wide toe box, but the rest of the shoe is not wide enough for someone with wide feet, even though they are advertised as wide width shoes. My husband wears a 13 or 14E and his toes fit in the toe box, but the opening of the shoe near the tongue is ridiculously tight. The tongue is stitched to the shoe, so the opening is so narrow. I was able to shoehorn his foot in, but there's no way he's going to wear these on the daily when they are nearly impossible to get on. I may try to carefully unpick the stitches at the tongue to see if that gives him enough room to get the shoe on more easily, but I'm not expecting much success. Disappointing, as they are nice looking shoes.

I like keeping a lightweight pair of shoes around the house to wear when running out to the mailbox, retrieving a package, and other similar household chores. These shoes are perfect for such occasions. The one thing that I would caution you about though is that the manufacturer means it when the shoes are described as barefoot and minimalist. The soles/insoles of these shoes provide little padding and almost no support. With virtually no heel, you are always walking on flat feet, which might aggravate an Achilles tendon if you have foot problems. So, if you have problems with your feet, you might want to pass on these shoes. If not, then these shoes might just be the lightweight shoes that you have been dreaming of. Give them a try!

评论概述: Run large. Seem made well and are comfortable
评论详情: These run large on me. They still work, but they don't fit like I would prefer. They are comfortable enough and seem made well. I'm happy enough with them. 4 stars.

评论概述: Soft and comfy but runs large
评论详情: The first thing I did was pull out the insole as I need a thin sole and zero drop. The insoles do have a bit of lift at the heel. I almost always wear a size10 and these were a bit big. The do have a nice wide toe box and generally are comfortable.

评论概述: Still not sure exactly what a barefoot shoe is, but these seem like good ones!
评论详情: Strangely, I like these shoes. I didn't know what to expect and ordered a pair entirely out of curiosity. So, if you're a "barefoot shoe" wearer, this review is not for you because you know all about what I'm a little puzzled over. For you, I'll just say this seems to me to be a fairly classy looking sneaker that is also well made.  But if, like me, you're trying to figure out if this might be worth trying, maybe I can help a little.  1. The toe box is really wide and the front of my foot feels shoeless. That was weird at first because I'm used to the traditional shoe feel. But it isn't "floppy" because it laces up snugly around the angle, and I am getting used to it. I like that my foot is not squeezed at all! 2. The sole is as flat as can be! That means no raised heel at all. At first, I felt like my heel was low, but it really is like standing on the floor. The fact that I have a shoe covering my foot tricks my brain, I think. Because when I kick them off, it feels the same on the floor; as a matter of fact, my flip-flops are also perfectly flat but I don't have the same sensation. That I can also get used to. 3. The best part is that while these at first felt like cheap sneakers or boat shoes, they are surprisingly comfortable. The uppers are soft and hug my feet from just in front of my angle to the back. The heel is flat but not hard and not "moccasin" like. It has a really nice cushioned spot right under the middle of my heel. This creates the sensation of being on a flat floor but with a spongey texture under the heel. Not sure if that makes sense, but it is the best I can do. I am an old dude with bad knees and I usually wear Sketchers because they have ridiculously soft insoles. I wear flip-flops in the house to help cushion the impact on wood floors, and these feel better than my flip-flops. Of course, not all flip-flops are the same. 4. Being barefoot involves a certain tradeoff in control. Barefoot shoes are supposed to provide natural control while giving some comfort and looking civilized (can't go out to dinner barefoot). Still the supposed control you have over your feet and your gait while barefoot does also give up control. Shoes, after all, do provide a stable platform and rotational control for the ankle primarily. These do feel like they provide a similar tradeoff--I don't feel like I'm really barefoot, but my feet move more as if they are. And so my ankles and legs operate a little more like that too, which feels funny because now I really am aware of how differently I walk with and without shoes. With these, I feel like I have shoes on but walk like I don't.  While I'm not sure I'll get used to these or end up liking them enough, I should repeat that they are a good looking and good quality shoe. If you're looking for a barefoot shoe, and you know what that means, this should be a good shoe for you. They seem like a good bet to experiment with too, if you're curious!  EDIT: I am editing before I actually post the review. I reread the product description and realized I wrote the above review not realizing I was wearing the shoes with the inserts they come with. I took them out and now I have more of that flat, hard feel I expected. I don't like that, but it definitely provides even more of the barefoot feel.

评论概述: A very different shoe, lacking support, runs large
评论详情: These shoes are very different than typical shoes due to the thin flat bottom, which offers no arch support.  The included paperwork suggests “starting slowly… for short distances so your foot can adjust to the “direct contact with the ground”, going on to say “Many people get sore muscles in their feet at first…”I wish I had read that prior to ordering, as I’m not interested in wearing shoes that “require your foot muscles to be rebuilt.”  It is odd, as I don’t wear shoes in the house, so I spend an enormous amount of time barefoot, so one would think having a “barefoot shoe” would not require any rebuilding of muscles.These shoes did not work for me for several reasons, first, they run large.  I normally wear a size 11 work boot and a 10.5 in a high-quality dress shoe.  As these are “wide”, I ordered a 10.5, which was too big, not just in the width, but in the length as well.  The loose fit coupled with the lack of support made for an uncomfortable shoe.  Also, due to the flexible bottom, the shoes flop when you walk, even more than flip-flops, which I found really annoying.The shoes are very lightweight, with very little structure, fashioned from a thin canvas like material.  I suppose some people may like the overall feel, I found it unpleasant.  Although, to be fair, I am very picky about my footwear and have a hard time finding shoes that fit well.  Your milage may vary.

评论概述: Comfortable once you get used to it. Very Light
评论详情: At first, this shoe felt awkward as I was not used to barefoot style shoes at all. It's strange how accustomed you become to the shoes you wear. After a day or two, I really began to understand the allure behind these and why they are popular. They are very light which adds to the comfort and makes them feel more like slippers than sneakers at times.  They are very wide. Even if you typically wear W sneakers or shoes, these will be wider than you are used to, especially in the toe area. Again, this took a little time to get used to but once you do, the next time you put on regular shoes you will wonder why they feel so tight all the time.  I'm happy with them, but I probably won't wear them for prolonged walks and instead will use them more for getting around the yard/neighborhood. I'm interested to see how they feel as they break in more but for now I am happy with the results.

My husband is nuts about these shoes. They are, he says, better than going barefoot. They have nice soles, thick enough for comfort and support, but thin enough to be aware of the ground beneath your feet. He especially enjoyed them on beach sand and made me jealous during a walk on a trail in the woods.  The shoes let his feet spread out as nature intended. They slip on and off without need of tying and untying, and they feel good all day long. They are true to size and fit like they were custom made. Finally, they look great! When these wear out, he wants another pair.

When I first got these, they smelled a bit odd and looked a bit like water shoes. The smell quickly diminished, and with socks, they felt less like water shoes. They do have a bit of a clown shoes vibe on account of the wide toe box. If you can get over them looking a little bit funny, they are pretty good minimalist shoes. I have tried a few minimalist designs before, so I knew that they would wear on my feet a little bit differently than conventional shoes, since they don't provide the same amount of support, mostly just protecting the bottoms of your feet a bit. The upper part is styled a bit like a classic wingtip sort of vibe to it, but it's somewhat understated. For around the house or for short trips, they work well. I found them fairly uncomfortable without socks, and wouldn't recommend wearing them that way.

Comfortable- but take some getting used to. Transition to the zero drop/barefoot design is a bit awkward at first.  However, these are very comfortable. We’ve been hearing from friends about the possible benefits of this style of shoe-the idea is that they are a more natural way to wear shoes. These shoes are pretty stylish as well with a casual down to earth vibe. They are pretty true to size - but meant to be comfortable so they are a bit roomy.  The wide toe box and soft structure makes them very nice to wear around the house.

They are sturdier than I thought they were going to be. These are now my go-to shoes for puttering around the yard we're taking the dog for a little walk. They are super comfortable and not bad made at all. These I can't help the recommend because I'm thinking of buying a couple more pair for when I finally do wear these ones out

I ordered these shoes for my husband and they are several sizes too big. Maybe the sizing is off or we received the wrong size. Otherwise, they look as pictured. I can’t offer any other insight because he cannot wear them.  Review for JACKSHIBO Men's Barefoot Shoes
